intro: Pleomele flexuosa, commonly known as the wandering bamboo or golden bamboo, is a member of the ginger family (Zingiberaceae). It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines and Indonesia. This plant is characterized by its stiff, arching stems and narrow, leathery leaves that often have a distinctive golden or yellowish hue. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Pleomele flexuosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
